questions.question_text:
An engineer is deploying VoIP and needs to ensure that voice traffic is treated with the highest priority on the network.

Which QoS priority should be assigned to such an application?

discussion.content: D. Real-time priority is typically recommended for applications affected by latency, and is particularly useful in guaranteeing performance and quality of voice and video applications.

Selected Answer: D
D is correct

Selected Answer: D
Real time priority
https://docs.paloaltonetworks.com/pan-os/9-1/pan-os-admin/quality-of-service/qos-use-cases/use-case-qos-for-voice-and-video-applications

questions.question_text:
A network security administrator wants to enable Packet-Based Attack Protection in a Zone Protection profile.

What are two valid ways to enable Packet-Based Attack Protection? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AB
A&B: 
https://docs.paloaltonetworks.com/pan-os/10-1/pan-os-admin/zone-protection-and-dos-protection/zone-defense/zone-protection-profiles/packet-based-attack-protection

Selected Answer: AB
A,B are Packet Based Attack protections
C,D are Flood Protection / SYN-Actions

Selected Answer: AB
A and B

Selected Answer: AB
A, B are correct.

AB 

Network > Network Profiles > Zone Protection > Packet Based Attack Protection
You can configure Packet Based Attack protection to drop the following types of packets:
IP Drop
TCP Drop
ICMP Drop
IPv6 Drop
ICMPv6 Drop

Selected Answer: AB
A B are correct
A& B correct
This question was on the exam.. Nov 2023

Selected Answer: B
B is correct

Selected Answer: B
Correct answer B
https://docs.paloaltonetworks.com/pan-os/10-1/pan-os-admin/monitoring/view-and-manage-logs/log-types-and-severity-levels/wildfire-submissions-logs

Selected Answer: C
Refer to Q300

comments.content: The answer to that question is the same: "yes, because the action is set to allow".

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
As long as the action is set to allow, then it will still allow it.
Threats that have the ability to become critical but have mitigating factors; for example, they may be difficult to exploit, do not result in elevated privileges, or do not have a large victim pool. WildFire Submissions log entries with a malicious verdict and an action set to allow are logged as High. https://docs.paloaltonetworks.com/pan-os/10-1/pan-os-admin/monitoring/view-and-manage-logs/log-types-and-severity-levels/threat-logs#id5cea1511-a153-4005-9d5f-ab2482e838ae

Selected Answer: B
Correct answer B
https://docs.paloaltonetworks.com/pan-os/10-1/pan-os-admin/monitoring/view-and-manage-logs/log-types-and-severity-levels/wildfire-submissions-logs

choices.D: Yes, because the action is set to “alert”
choices.C: No, because the severity is “high” and the verdict “malicious”
choices.A: No, because this is an example from a defeated phishing attack.
choices.B: Yes, because the action is set to “allow”

questions.question_text:
Given the following snippet of a WildFire submission log, did the end-user get access to the requested information and why or why not?

//IMG//

comments.content: The explanation we all need. Thanks!

discussion.content:
Correct is D
They want to protect just one specific server, if you apply the zone protection you are protecting the entire zone
Answer:D

Selected Answer: D
for one specific server

Selected Answer: D
D is correct

Correct is D
DOS protection if for resources behind the firewall. Zone Protection is for the firewall.

Answer D is the correct one. Classified profiles protect individual critical resources, especially servers that users access from the internet, and are often attack targets, such as web servers, database servers, and DNS servers. 

Please refer to https://docs.paloaltonetworks.com/pan-os/10-1/pan-os-admin/zone-protection-and-dos-protection/zone-defense/dos-protection-profiles-and-policy-rules/classified-versus-aggregate-dos-protection
Correct answer : D
Correct answer is D

https://docs.paloaltonetworks.com/pan-os/9-1/pan-os-admin/zone-protection-and-dos-protection/zone-defense/dos-protection-profiles-and-policy-rules/classified-versus-aggregate-dos-protection#id56c14277-0ecd-4e32-b3d3-7b616176204a
D.

Selected Answer: D
D. Apply a classified DoS Protection Profile.

Selected Answer: D
D is correct.

Selected Answer: D
D. Single protection is for DoS.

D is the right answer
Packet Buffer protection is indeed the way to protect against resource exhaustion, but it is not configured under DoS protection profile. It is directly enabled under Zones.
D is the correct answer
Definitely D is correct
D -- it couldn't be else
D is the correct answer, for specific servers not the entire zone so correct answer is not A
D is correct

I would say D
DoS protection can be used to mitigate Flood protection and Resource based protection (maximum concurrent sessions).
Classified is grouping of hosts that are protected.

I'm also guessing D. 
however I would love if these consistency issues in their questions were resolved as well. in most other dos questions they specifically mention distributed denial of service, here they only mention dos (not ddos) which would send you to the packet buffer protection answer. 
but as statedd that's part of zone protection which does not protect a specific group/server, so it's D. 
still bit of a confusing trick question?
Correct is D

Answer is D. 

The DOS Protection policy and profile provide flexible rules and matching criteria that enable you to protect destination zone and specific end host such as web servers, DNS servers or any servers that are critical or have been prone to DOS attacks.
Correct is D
Correct ans = D
Correct is D

questions.question_text:
A client is concerned about resource exhaustion because of denial-of-service attacks against their DNS servers.
Which option will protect the individual servers?

choices.C: Use the DNS App-ID with application-default.
choices.B: Apply an Anti-Spyware Profile with DNS sinkholing.
choices.A: Enable packet buffer protection on the Zone Protection Profile.
choices.D: Apply a classified DoS Protection Profile.

questions.question_text:
The decision to upgrade to PAN-OS 10.2 has been approved. The engineer begins the process by upgrading the Panorama servers, but gets an error when trying to install.

When performing an upgrade on Panorama to PAN-OS 10.2, what is the potential cause of a failed install?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Answer is B

Selected Answer: B
B. Outdated plugins

Selected Answer: B
B is correct.
This question was on the exam.. Nov 2023

Selected Answer: B
The answer is definitely B:

https://docs.paloaltonetworks.com/pan-os/10-2/pan-os-upgrade/upgrade-panorama-plugins/panorama-plugins-upgrade-downgrade-considerations

Selected Answer: B
Answer is B (outdated plugins)

Selected Answer: B
B is correct

Selected Answer: B
Answer is B (outdated plugins). ... 
https://docs.paloaltonetworks.com/pan-os/11-0/pan-os-upgrade/upgrade-panorama-plugins/panorama-plugins-upgrade-downgrade-considerations
Before you upgrade to PAN-OS 11.0, you must download the Panorama plugin version supported on PAN-OS 11.0 for all plugins installed on Panorama. This is required to successfully upgrade to PAN-OS 11.0. See the Compatibility Matrixfor more information.
